This is a digital download only game, contains only a SP campaign, is roughly 2 hours in length, and was developed in 6 months. It will sell on Steam, Xbox Live, and PSN for $10. It doesn't even have full live-action cutscenes, from what I understand. Basically, the model of full, 60-dollar movie franchise games hasn't worked that well, so konami is trying something different here. Anyway, that's why the game is so small. It's not what you would call a complete retail release.

Well, at first I had crashs, even after having used the content of the support folder to perform the necessary system updates... but then I tried to launch the game "as Administrator"... and this time it worked !

So, if you're on Windows 7 (64 bits), and are having crashs when launching the game, try to LAUNCH IT "AS AN ADMINISTRATOR" (right click on the launch icon, and select "Execute as an administrator" (or something like that cause I'm not using English OS so I'm not sure of the exact translation).

OK works perfect !
For those who cant run the game or get error do this : Right Click>Properties>Compatibility>Run>Windows XP (Service )

If you have to disable your AV on cracked games then you either have some crapware like McAfee or the crack is infected.
I run ESET Smart Security and have never once had a false positive.

AVG, McAfee, Symantec (Norton) all blow-goats.
Only ESET and Microsoft's own AV (yep really) are any good.
AVG, McAfee and Symantec (AMS) all take money from the various publishers to add well know cracks to their signature files - ESET and Microsoft don't. That means AMS are all bloated and slow.

I'm not sure if some of you are illiterate or just dumb. You don't need an activation key as arathanstorrents posted earlier.

In the skidrow folder there is a .dll file called paul.dll

You copy this file and paste it where you installed the game inside the BIN folder. Replace the old file with this .dll and you are good to go.

Wow. This is about as generic as it gets. 

Washed out colors, dated textures, dirty bump mapping, mostly static shading, scripted "physics", underwhelming weapons effects, boring level design, average audio at best... played it for 20 minutes and almost fell asleep.

Hollywood cashing in again. Mass produced bullshit cash grab.

If a game based on a movie comes out within a year of the theatrical release, beware. If it comes out at the same time, just don't bother at all.

I keep going against my instinct, hoping maybe one day someone will do it right, but it's always the same. Games released as basically part of a movie promo package are absolute trash.

Okay, running Win7 (64b) and my game didn't even load up, all I did was change Compatibility to Vista SP2 and Run As Admin.

Works just fine now.

Oh and btw, to change to 1920*1080 res, you need to go DOWN, you can't find it by going up in resolution.

Alright, this game looks terrible but here's how I fixed the instant crash :

** Windows 7 x64 **
- Go to "C:\...\Battle Los Angeles\bin"
- Right click "BattleLA.exe"
- Select "Property"
- Open "Compatibility" tab
- Check "Run this programs in compatibility mode for: "
Windows XP (Service Pack 2)
- Apply, exit and launch the game.

Cheers !

The graphics are okay (8/10). The sound is good (7/10). Gameplay is quite nice but the controls are twitchy (6/10). Replayability? No, you don't have to play it again 'cuz it sucks. But not bad for a cheap game.

To extremezone: Thank you for this.
